item.title: HarvestAPI for Mobile and Tablet
item.description: On November 6, 2014, I worked on the media min-width size for each device.

item.title: Return To Office
item.description: On November 5. 2014 I returned to the office after a week long of Chik V. I continued working on getting the mobile and tablet side of HarvestAPI to show well on screen. I got the menu to have a button appearance for each of the tabs at the header.

item.title: Chikungunya Virus/Work from Home Pt 2
item.description: On November 4, 2014, despite feeling a bit better from the virus I was advised to stayed home since yesterday for safety measures so I did some research on fixing the HarvestAPI page from home.

item.title: Chikungunya Virus/Work From Home
item.description: On November 3, 2014, despite feeling a bit better from the virus I was advised to stayed home for the next two days for safety measures so I did some research on fixing the HarvestAPI page from home.

item.title: Graduation Day/Chikungunya Virus
item.description: On Friday October 31, 2014 I recovered from the fever and some of my joints were feeling better so I was able to make it to the graduation ceremony. Even though I still had the virus in me, I couldn’t let that stop me from reaching a once in a lifetime event.

item.title: Chikungunya Virus
item.description: On Thursday October 30, 2014 I stayed at my cousins’ house next door to try and recover in time for graduation the following day since I was diagnosed with the Chikungunya virus. It was painful due to joint pains and severe fever. I was advised by Varun Baker to take some papaya leaf juice which was to be taken twice (once every 3 hours) along with panadol. I took the panadol in the evenings to knock me out to sleep.

item.title: Mobile and Tablet for HarvestAPI Progress and Chikungunya Virus
item.description:
On Wednesday October 29,2014 I continued doing sum research on finding out how to make HarvestAPI appear better on mobile phones and tablets. Upon using https://app.getmobilizer.com/ the screens look like these below:

Image 1

Image 2

Image 3

Image 4

Image 5

Image 6

Image 7

Image 8

Image 9

As seen from above, for every device shown in the app-mobilizer, they all appear differently from each other. During midday I came down with the chikungunya virus.

item.title: Looking on the Mobile and Tablet View of HarvestAPI (Cont'd)
item.description: On Monday October 28, 2014 I Started looking on a css file called normailze.css to see if it can help improve the appearance of elements on the mobile and tablet side of HarvestAPI, as well as made note of the problems that were faced in the CSS side of HarvestAPI. I also discovered a mobile viewer site called https://app.getmobilizer.com/

item.title: Looking on the Mobile and Tablet View of HarvestAPI
item.description: On Monday October 27, 2014 I continued working on HarvestAPI main page and I also spotted where the main issues were on the mobile and tablet view of the page.

item.title: Creating The Blog For This Week
item.description: On Friday October 24, 2014, I was working on changes that need to be made on HarvestAPI regarding the CSS that controls mobile and tablet appearances as well as writing my blog for this week. I have also removed one of the contents for HarvestAPI which was requested by Matthew MacNaughton.
